scenario_text.value: Um, Takuma...
Yeah? What is it?

Well...do you really think we’re going to
make it back home?
Uh...

(I shouldn’t say anything that’s going to
upset Miu.)

(I’d like to tell her I’m sure we will, and
promise to go to an amusement park together,)

(but I’ve got nothing to back that up, so
saying that might make her more worried.)

(Maybe if I make light of it, that would
help. Like I could suggest we flip a coin.)

(Or I could try telling her there’s no way
we’ll make it, and get her to deny that.)
(What should I say to Miu?)
Let’s flip a coin.
We’ll go to a park!
There’s no way.
Let’s flip a coin.

I don’t know, but if you’re that worried
about it, we could try flipping a coin.

Flipping a coin?! What is wrong with you?!
I’m serious about this!

I can’t believe you’d make fun of me like
that!

No... I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to make fun of
you.

What if this doesn’t work out, and none of us
can go home? What then?

Uh... I guess we’ll just have to try and make
sure that doesn’t happen?
Yeah... I guess you’re right...
We’ll go to a park!

Look, I can’t promise you that we’ll make it,
but I do believe that things will be okay.

So how about this... When we do make it back,
let’s go to an amusement park. A real one.
You mean, you, me, and my brother?

Right, and if you’re okay with it, we could
invite Minoru, Aoi, and everyone else too.

Yeah...that sounds nice! We’ll all go to an
amusement park. It’s a promise!
And you’d better keep it! No matter what!
I will. I promise, Miu.
There’s no way.
No. There’s no way.
What? Wh-why would you say that?!

I...I was so sure you’d say we’d make it no
matter what.
I was convinced of it!
Then everything’s fine.
Huh?

Because that means you’re really convinced
we’ll make it back, right?
Which means everything’s fine.

So, you lied to me just now? Takuma, how
could you?!
Haha, sorry!

(But really, somewhere deep down, I can’t
help but wonder if we’re not all doomed.)
(That much is true.)

Anyway, right now our number one priority is
to find Aoi.

After that, it’ll be rescuing Miyuki. Those
are what we should be focused on.
Everything else we can deal with later.

Yeah, you’re right. We can’t do anything if
we don’t find Aoi.
You know, you and Aoi are kind of similar.
Really? You think so?

Yeah, well, whenever I started to feel like
this was all too much and wanted to cry,

Aoi would tell me the same sort of thing.
Like I should focus on eating, go to sleep,

and save all the worrying for later. She was
always so nice about telling me what to do.

Yeah, Aoi always tried to get us to take care
of ourselves, no matter how panicked we got.

Mm-hm, even though she had to have been
really scared too.

She was always looking out for us, taking
care of us...

It felt like she was my real big sister, she
was so nice.

Kaito and Minoru said she must’ve been hiding
how she really felt...

...but I don’t think her kindness was a lie.
I think she meant it when she was nice to us.

You’re right. I think that much is true.
That’s how I feel too.
Yeah, that’s gotta be it!

Aoi may have hidden things from us, but
I don’t think her kindness was a lie.
